anomaly_detection package¶

Submodules¶

anomaly_detection.adtk_bounds module¶

class anomaly_detection.adtk_bounds.ADTK_Bounds(adtk_obj, s)¶

Bases: object

This class creates the mathematical bounds that the ADTK package uses in order to determine if a point is an anomaly or not.

ratio_bounds(numerator, denominator, delta=1)¶

Calculate the ratio bounds for ADTK algorithms.

Parameters

delta (float) – Required; default 1. Offset to bounds.

Returns

Pandas DataFrame with ratio bound violations.

univ_bounds(delta=0.0001)¶

Calculate the univariate bounds for ADTK algorithms.

Parameters

delta (float) – Required; default .0001. Offset to bounds.

Returns

Pandas DataFrame with univariate bound violations.

anomaly_detection.anomaly module¶

class anomaly_detection.anomaly.Anomaly(df, var_type='univariate', numerator=None, denominator=None)¶

Bases: object

Class that allows for detecting anomalies through a variety of machine learning and control chart methodologies. Inspiration is from the ADTK library in Python, which can be found here - https://adtk.readthedocs.io/en/stable/

ad_kmeans_high_dim(n_clusters=3, test=True)¶

Fits an Anomaly Detection K-Means Chart, which detects anomalies based on clustering of historical data.

Parameters

  • n_clusters (int) – Number of clusters to form. Default is 3.

  • test (bool) – Default True. Returns chart bounds for a given metric in order to validate its use and appropriateness.

Returns

Bounds if test = True, message validating ad_kmeans_high_dim() is added to class parameters if test = False.

ad_pca(k=1, test=True)¶

Fits an Anomaly Detection Principal Component Analysis (PCA) Chart, which performs principal component analysis (PCA) to the multivariate time series (every time point is treated as a point in high-dimensional space), measures reconstruction error at every time point, and identifies a time point as anomalous when the recontruction error is beyond anomalously large.

Parameters

  • k (int) – Default 1. Number of principal components to use.

  • test (bool) – Default True. Returns chart bounds for a given metric in order to validate its use and appropriateness.

Returns

Bounds if test = True, message validating ad_pca() is added to class parameters if test = False.

ad_quantile(high=0.99, low=0.01, delta=0.0001, test=True)¶

Fits an Anomaly Detection Quantile chart.

Parameters

  • high (float) – Required, default .99. Must be float between 0 and 1. Determines violation range for upper bound.

  • low (float) – Required, default .01. Must be float between 0 and 1. Determines violation range for lower bound.

  • delta (float) – Required, default .0001. Offset value for creating bounds.

  • test (bool) – Default True. Returns chart bounds for a given metric in order to validate its use and appropriateness.

Returns

Bounds if test = True, message validating ad_quantile() is added to class parameters if test = False.

ad_regression(c=3.0, test=True)¶

Fits an Anomaly Detection Regression Chart, which detects anomalies based on a regression relationship.

Parameters

  • c (float) – Default 3.0. Factor used to determine the bound of normal range based on historical interquartile range.

  • test (bool) – Default True. Returns chart bounds for a given metric in order to validate its use and appropriateness.

Returns

Bounds if test = True, message validating ad_regression() is added to class parameters if test = False.

ad_seasonal(c=3.0, side='both', test=True)¶

Fits an Anomaly Detection Seasonal chart.

Parameters

  • c (float) – Default 3.0. Factor used to determine the bound of normal range based on historical interquartile range.

  • side (str) – Default “both”.

  • If “both”, to detect anomalous positive and negative residuals;

  • If “positive”, to only detect anomalous positive residuals;

  • If “negative”, to only detect anomalous negative residuals.

Parameters

test (bool) – Default True. Returns chart bounds for a given metric in order to validate its use and appropriateness.

Returns

Bounds if test = True, message validating ad_seasonal() is added to class parameters if test = False.

assemble(weights=None)¶

Combine multiple anomaly detection algorithms based on a pre-provided weighting.

Parameters

weights (list) – Stores a list of weights to assign to each anomaly detection algorithm. Sum of values provided to weights must be equal to 1.

Returns

concatenated DataFrame with combined AD predictions.

new_obs(df)¶

Applies previous fit of anomaly detection algorithms to new observations for control charts.

Parameters

df (DataFrame) – A data frame including new observations to be fit on.

Returns

None.

spc(chart, test=True)¶

Runs an SPC chart based on the chosen chart type.

Parameters

  • chart (str) – Required. Current options: “p”.

  • test (bool) – Default True. Returns chart bounds for a given metric in order to validate its use and appropriateness.

Returns

None.

validate(date_col)¶

Validates inputs to the class are the approprite type.

Parameters

chart (str) – Required. Name of Date column in data frame.

anomaly_detection.spc module¶

class anomaly_detection.spc.SPC(df)¶

Bases: object

“This class creates necessary functions for Statistical Process Control (SPC) charts.

Currently, only p-charts are developed due to their ubiquity with Quality Control in healthcare.

The general workflow of the class is as follows:

  1. Fit data to a method (currently the option is p-chart) on a certain date range. This will represent the baseline data.

  2. Predict new anomalies based on the baseline fit. This can be done with predict().

bounds(predict=False)¶

Creates bound for chosen control chart.

Parameters

predict (bool) – Default False. Set True if the predict() function has been used.

Returns

DataFrame with the following columns: * Values * UCL * LCL * Violation

p_chart(numerator, denominator)¶

Runs the calculations necessary to create a p-chart on baseline data.

Parameters

  • numerator (str) – Required. The name of the numerator in the data frame fed into the class.

  • denominator (str) – Required. The name of the denominator in the data frame fed into the class.

Returns

DataFrame column specifying binary yes/no violations.

predict(df)¶

Predicts anomalies depending on the baseline fit.

Parameters

df (DataFrame) – DataFrame to predict new violations on.

Returns

DataFrame column specifying binary yes/no violations.
